entry.title: Fix to avoid non perfect cadences from being throttled
entry.content:
Throttling non perfect cadences, such as 60 HZ screen refresh

rate over 24 FPS cause throttling to lower the framerate so

restrict throttling to only apply only when the refresh rate is

a multiple of the desired throttle.



Fix for throttling wrongfully throttling when refresh rate matches video fps



When the refresh rate matches the video framerate and in some other

cases when getting to the actual vsync where it should schedule

a vsync there is numerical error that happens almost always that

cause an extra vsync to be throttled. This is particularly bad

as the refresh rate is lower as the missed vsync represents

a significant downgrade of framerate.



Bug: b/284356269

Change-Id: I5185a3d18476a5c8d475a25463c36001d2288c13

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4633852

entry.title: updater: fix crash in AppInstallControllerImpl::DoCancel.
entry.content:
`update_service_` is initialized when the instance of

`AppInstallControllerImpl` is created but it is reset when

the `UpdateService::Install` call completes. Therefore, a push on the

close button of the UI will make the code crash when `DoCancel()`

attempts to cancel the installs using the `update_service_` interface.



This code is to be rewritten soon, so this is the simplest fix right now.



Fixed: 1458431

Change-Id: Ic9ba36580dc633efed8889358823c98a787fc3d6

entry.title: [DataRetentionPolicies] Adding a Test Switch for BrowsingDataLifetime
entry.content:
The new switch --simulate-browsing-data-lifetime makes it easier to test

BrowsingDataLifetime policy by waiting for a few minutes instead of

1 hour +. When the BrowsingDataLifetime policy is set and chrome is run

with this switch the behaviour is as follows:



- The data lifetime is 3 minutes.

- The data removal happens every 5 minutes.



The switch has no effect if the BrowserDataLifetime policy is not set.



Change-Id: I4890e4e9f163408c514a9fce83668e8fbb983355

entry.title: [Performance Settings] Prevent scrollbar from showing in add dialog
entry.content:
Adds overflow: hidden to prevent horizontal scrollbars from showing in

the tabbed add dialog. Previously, when switching to the add current

sites tab using left/right arrow keys, a horizontal scrollbar would

momentarily be visible. This started occuring on non-Mac platforms after

the help text on the add sites manually tab was changed, affecting the

width of the containing element. It did not occur on Mac due to the font

having different width.



Fixed: 1454496

entry.title: Add vsync updates to BackToBackBeginFrameSource
entry.content:
This CL adjusts the frame scheduling deadline of

BackToBackBeginFrameSource to match the current display vsync interval,

rather than the arbitrary 60Hz default. Vsync updates are communicated

from AsyncLayerTreeFrameSink in response to frame presentation.



This adjusted behavior is gated behind a new blink runtime feature,

UseBeginFramePresentationFeedback, which is enabled by default.



Bug: b:287274571

Change-Id: I21debccab724827e7a7e63a6ab46e8356474de93

entry.title: Reland "Always create cached_rects_ for IntersectionOptimization"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 30837c23a4f2c8ef90677011d69cee495e80cc97.



The original CL exposed under-invalidation issues when e.g.

a LayoutObject's location changes due to sibling resize. To avoid

the issues, this CL doesn't use the cached rects for implicit

roots. It still create cached rects to store

min_scroll_delta_to_update for IntersectionOptimization.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Always create cached_rects_ for IntersectionOptimization"

>

> This reverts commit 5e5909205f4b426289eed35ccabe58f5e22c3381.

>

> Reason for revert: The CL caused failures of display lock unit tests

> with IntersectionOptimization enabled.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Always create cached_rects_ for IntersectionOptimization

> >

> > This allows cached rects for implicit root with target in the outermost

> > main frame. If the target is in a sub frame, IntersectionGeometry won't

> > use the cached rects due to the relationship.

> >

> > Bug: 1400495

> > Change-Id: Idc2efb9e3affbbcfacb87d989eaa0c139b6516e5

entry.title: webauthn: make Fido2CredentialRequest able to handle caBLE requests.
entry.content:
caBLE requests need to be able to pass in a clientDataHash from the

other device, and they don't have a `RenderFrameHost` nor `WebContents`.

Thus this change pulls several values that are currently obtained in

slightly odd ways, up to the interface of `Fido2CredentialRequest`. For

example, the `Activity` was obtained by getting a `WebContents` from a

`RenderFrameHost` (which doesn't work in tests) and then find the

activity from the window. That's fine, but it's quite context-specific

this far down the call stack. Thus `Activity` becomes a parameter (and

that solves a problem for the caBLE code too.)



Low-Coverage-Reason: trying without punctuation to see if this works

entry.title: Add allocator crash keys when reading PMA files
entry.content:
This also adds a "clean exit" bit in the PMA files. So it's easier to

tell if a PMA file being read comes from a crashed session. This is not perfect since it's still possible for the device or browser to

crash after this bit is set. In any case, in practice this should be

fine? (Only used to help investigate crash dumps).



Also updates the "kGlobalVersion" so that we know how old a PMA file

is in the crash reports (i.e., whether the file comes from a version

before or after the introduction of this "clean exit" bit).



In persistent_memory_allocator.cc, there was also a check that if

a PersistentMemoryAllocator is instantiated with memory that already

exists, and the "version" doesn't match, then it is set to corrupt.

I modified this CHECK because that's not quite accurate, since changes

may be made in a backwards-compatible way.

entry.title: assistant: Reduce the retries of service restart
entry.content:
In some situations, the Assistant service may not start. This cl reduces

the number of times to restart the service.



We decide whether to start service based on two counters:

1. the backoff `failure_count`, and

2. the pref value `kAssistantNumFailuresSinceLastServiceRun`.



1. Will not restart service if the `failure_count` is larger than

`kMaxStartServiceRetries`. Note that the `failure_count` will

change:

1.a. Increment by 1 for every service disconnected.

1.b. Reset to 0 when explicitly re-enable the Assistant from the

Settings.

1.c. Reset to 0 when re-login the device.

1.d. Decrement by 1 when it has been `kAutoRecoverTime`.



2. Will not restart service if the pref value

`kAssistantNumFailuresSinceLastServiceRun` is larger than

`kMaxStartServiceRetries`, unless `failure_count` is 0, e.g. the

first time login. Note that the

`kAssistantNumFailuresSinceLastServiceRun` will change:

2.a. Increment by 1 for every service disconnected.

2.b. Reset to 0 when every service running.



Bug: b:264449607

entry.title: variations: Write FieldTrialCreatorBase
entry.content:
Create a superclass for VariationsFieldTrialCreator, which will be used

by cros/evaluate_seed.cc to create field trials.



This class must be minimal-dependency, so that evaluate_seed can meet

its strict compiled code size restrictions.



Accordingly, it does not determine locale or modify UI string overrides,

and it will not require a multithreaded environment to be set up if a

read-only local_state is passed in. It will also seamlessly support a

read-only local_state.



The newly introduced _base.{cc,h} files are copied nearly verbatim

from the existing {cc,h} files, so I plan *not* to fix the Tricium

findings that were already present.



BUG=b:263975722

TEST=CQ

entry.title: arc: Fix UpdateEnabledStateByUserTypeUMA crash
entry.content:
http://crrev.com/c/4629590 changes UpdateEnabledStateByUserTypeUMA

to use GetBrowserContextByUser but neglected the case that there

could be no user when UpdateEnabledStateByUserTypeUMA is called.

GetBrowserContextByUser crashes when there is no user. This CL

fixes the crash by null check primary user before calling into

GetBrowserContextByUser.

entry.title: Set child status even if capabilities are unchanged
entry.content:
For child accounts that were present prior to the

kEnableSupervisionOnDesktopAndIOS flag being enabled, we must run

through the code that sets the child account status even if the

account capabilities have not changed in the latest fetch. Otherwise,

such accounts never have their child status updated.

entry.title: Initialize a host activity for OpenXR
entry.content:
On Android there are advantages to having OpenXR use a separate

Activity from the rest of the browser, as it offers better control

over the activity lifetime, style, and prevents OpenXR runtimes

from making changes to the primary activity.



This change creates a dedicated OpenXR host Activity on session

start, which shuts down when the session ends.

entry.title: Add support for Fresnel import data and PSM membership queries.
entry.content:
Support Fresnel PSM import data and membership queries.

It introduces new proto messages and enums to facilitate the

transmission of data related to Device Actives and PSM membership checks.



The messages define various fields and metadata associated with device

information, market segments, channels, and cohort observations.



BUG=chromium:1449132

entry.title: [ios] Change completed SetUpList item text color to increase contrast
entry.content:
Previously we were using a lower-contrast text_quaternary_color. This

changes to use text_secondary_color which should meet the a11y

requirement to have the text contrast be at least 4.5:1.



Screenshot with the changed text color:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8RvjPUYYBtLGd86.png



Using the screenshot above, a contrast measurement shows 4.9:1 for the

strikethrough text, which is above the threshold.

entry.title: [fix-swo-violations] Fix sort comparison function
entry.content:
Use < instead of <= to make sure comparator uses strict weak ordering.

Using a comparator which is not a strict weak ordering is undefined

behavior and crashes with _LIBCPP_DEBUG_STRICT_WEAK_ORDERING_CHECK

enabled.

entry.title: [Reauth][Android] User pref is not respected for local cards
entry.content:
For local cards on settings page:

1. If an opted-out user opts-in to mandatory reauth, authentication

challenge is not offered to open the local card edit page.

2. If an opted-in user opts-out of mandatory reauth, authentication

challenge is offered to open the local card edit page.

Both these behavior happens only once after opting in or out.



When cards are populated in the settings page, their on-click behaviors

are defined based on the state of the reauth pref at that point. When a

user opts in or out of reauth, this behavior doesn't change, and it only

gets updated when the page refreshes.



Configure the on-click behaviors to check for the reauth pref after the

click has happened to get the latest pref value.



Before: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTEyMzgyMTE1NDU5ODkxMnw2M2RiMWUwNy0xZQ

After: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTkxMTcxMDYyNDkwNzI2NHwxYzBlNWM4Zi1iYw

entry.title: Extensions: WFH: Open in a new tab instead of a window and a new tab
entry.content:
This CL changes how files app launches apps so that extensions being

launched by a file handler will select an existing browser. Extensions

will launch in a tab in an existing window.



This works because `window_info` as nullptr sets `display_id` to

`display::kInvalidDisplayId` later on [1], which is the default value.

`display::kDefaultDisplayId` is not. The default value allows a window

on any display to be reused, i.e. a wildcard.



A myriad of different types of apps use AppServiceFileTasks, yet all but

Web File Handlers should be affected by this change. That's because only

WFH and a few others open in tabs. The rest either do not or allow for

customization such that this change would not change their behavior.



FBH (File Browser Handlers) use LaunchExtension, which ignores

`window_info` entirely. So this change is intended to only effect WFH,

and is more idiomatic with hose LaunchAppWithIntent is called.



[1] An example:

crsrc.org/chrome/browser/apps/app_service/publishers/extension_apps_base.cc;l=203;drc=c21cc822cec42b939d8608789515088497f16f76



Doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WisMKxG_uVKyK2taDcEfRwmP4RsUO5bJji9BbykfFVw

entry.title: [Contextual Search] Revive 4 tests in ContextualSearchCriticalTest.
entry.content:
The 4 disabled tests in ContextualSearchCriticalTest

testChainedSearchCreatesNewContent

testChainedSearchLoadsCorrectSearchTerm

testChainedSearchContentVisibility

testChainedTapsRemovedFromHistory



are the tests that make multiple calls to simulate{Non}ResolveSearch(),

i.e., try to open the panel when it is already open (peeked). For these

tests, 2 causes for failures were found:

1. "Space problem": TapFarFromPreviousSuppression suppresses clicks

that > 75 dp (see RETAP_DISTANCE_SQUARED_DP) away from the previous

click. For the test case with "Search Term Resolution", increase

screen resolutions have made "Search" and "Resolution" so distant

that successive clicking would cause the suppression to kick in. It

seems this issue was mitigated by retryPanelBarInteractions(), which

repeats clicks -- but that only masks the problem. Combined with (2)

below, this issue manifests as error message:



Caused by: org.chromium.base.test.util.CriteriaNotSatisfiedException:

Expected: is "Resolution"

but: was null



This issue affects:

testChainedSearchLoadsCorrectSearchTerm_

testChainedSearchContentVisibility



2. "Time problem": ContextualSearchInstrumentationBase.clickWordNode()

simulates click and waits for the panel to peek. However, when the

panel is already peeked from an earlier click, the wait exits

quickly. This breaks the callers trigger{Non}Resolve(), which rely

on the wait to temporarily tweak "decided" to a provided value. In

particular, the non-resolved flow (tweak to false) on "Resolution"

would behave as the resolved flow, and lead to assertion errors,

e.g., mFakeServer.getLoadedUrlCount() returning the wrong value.



This CL fixing (2) and revives the 4 tests. The fix changes

trigger{Non}Resolve() to wait for a "fresh" panel peek by ignoring an

existing peeked panel. Ultimately this detects a fresh call to

OverlayPanel.peekPanel(). Ideally we'd use an observer, but since the

testing framework uses polling and delays, so a simple time-based

solution is used:

* Have OverlayPanel store |mLastPeekInstant|, updated on each

peekPanel() call, and accessed via getLastPeekInstant().

* In ContextualSearchInstrumentationBase, add

waitForPanelToFreshlyPeek(), which is like waitForPanelToPeek() but

also waits for getLastPeekInstant() to change.

* Change clickWordNode() to use waitForPanelToFreshlyPeek().



Note that (1) is now benign, with retryPanelBarInteractions() creating

repeated click to close panel and reopen to elide the suppression

problem. We'll address it in a follow-up.



Bug: 1192285

entry.title: Revert "Return SessionNotCreated if session creation fails"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 944112f3a10489c9677849a2deed6bb71ee6e433.



Reason for revert: Some code paths must return error codes different from SessionNotCreated (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1430078#c19)



Original change's description:

> Return SessionNotCreated if session creation fails

>

> Up until now ChromeDriver used to return different error codes

> for various errors that could happen during session creation.

> This did not coply with the WebDriver standard that requires

> to return "session not created" error code.

> See: https://www.w3.org/TR/webdriver/#new-session

>

> Bug: chromedriver:4379

entry.title: Significantly throttle DumpWithoutCrashing
entry.content:
base::debug::DumpWithoutCrashing() is being used as a drop-in

replacement for NOTREACHED() where instances are still being hit. This

comes with the unpleasant footgun where NOTREACHED() reporting basically

goes from once per process to once every 5 minutes. This risks flooding

the crash server which risks merges and respins.



Anyone who needs to dump at a more frequent interval should own that

footgun themselves (specify dumping interval and justify it).



Bug: None

Change-Id: I331dc53cc5c3ccce7fe78e1fc05c4a819da4a4a2

entry.title: [iOS] Show migrate button section for local profiles
entry.content:
AutofillProfileTableViewController decides whether to show the cloud off icon for a profile. For the profiles where the cloud off icon is displayed, when the profile details view is opened, a migration to account button is to be shown.



The flow of the attribute is as follows:

1. AutofillProfileTableViewController initialises the attribute.

2. When the didSelectRow is called, the attribute value is sent to the AutofillProfileEditCoordinator through the constructor.

3. AutofillProfileEditCoordinator sends it to the mediator via the constructor.

4. The mediator sends the attribute value to the view controller via the consumer protocol.

entry.title: Prediction for ac=unrecognized: Metrics
entry.content:
When kAutofillPredictionsForAutocompleteUnrecognized is enabled, types

are predicted for ac=unrecognized fields (but they are not filled).

Because we don't want to change the baseline of the key metrics,

ac=unrecognized fields need to be excluded from them.



Since key metrics are logged through the form event logger, this is done

by changing BAM::GetEventFormLogger(FieldTypeGroup) to

BAM::GetEventFormLogger(AutofillField). With this interface, the

function can decide to return an event form logger only for

ac != unrecognized fields.

Some other calls to the event loggers exist, but they are independent

of individual fields/their predictions - and thus not affected.



The second category of metrics that we want to retain are metrics

reliant on the form types (= containing at least one address field).

Otherwise, forms completely annotated with ac=unrecognized suddently

become address forms. For this reason, FormStructure::GetFormTypes()

is changed.



There exist other metrics among Autofill's countless metrics which rely

on the field types in some way. For most of them, changes in the metrics

will be accepted. A notable example is the FieldPredictionQuality

metric.

Autofill.Autocomplete.{NotOff,Off}.* metrics are discussed here:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4547325/comments/eb49ed47_0428b29f



Bug: 1446318

Change-Id: Iac25b7c3de9fbe96a45fba2490525ab6153d005c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4545863

entry.title: [iOS] Fix promo spinner for reading list & bookmarks
entry.content:
During the sign-in using the sign-in promo in bookmarks or reading list

screen, a spinner should appear on the promo's main action button during

the initial download of account storage data.



The spinner's appearance is controlled by the `isSigninInProgress`

boolean in `SigninPromoViewMediator`. So this value need to be set

to NO only after the initial download.



This CL makes the promo mediator listen to the initial download events

entry.title: Revert "Prevent non-closable tabs from being closed"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 889fff9f35c578e4da34c2a2ae4ef4c7bb49130a.



Reason for revert: Blocking LKGM by breaking multiple crostini tests. See b/288972458 for more details.



Original change's description:

> Prevent non-closable tabs from being closed

>

> This CL implements admin configurable non-closable apps.

> These apps should neither be closable through closing the only web app

> tab (which this CL implements) nor by closing the window containing the

> app (future CL). The check is placed in `TabStripModel::CloseTabs` to

> ensure the tab cannot be closed, as all paths to close a tab go through

> this method. The close prevention is achieved by filtering all tabs

> that cannot be closed from the list of tabs to close.

>

entry.title: Check force-installed policy in HasIsolatedStorage()
entry.content:
This CL makes HasIsolatedStorage() more robust by also checking the

force-install extension policy in case the extension could not be

found in the extension registry. The login screen extension is not

present in any of the extension registry's lists during extension

update (when the old SW is unregistered and the new SW is registered).

The old SW's context is fetched by using HasIsolatedStorage(), and an

incorrect SW context is returned because HasIsolatedStorage() returns

false, leading to a failed unregistration.



Avoid edge cases such as this (and b/279763783) in the future by also

checking the force-installed policy.



Bug: b:287924795

Change-Id: I588d58fd993f8dbecc6bdc243c0d429e440a77a4

entry.title: Implement ProfileTokenQuality::GetObservationTypesForFieldType().
entry.content:
Implements the getter. It additionally introduces a function to add an

observation (and potentially discard the oldest one). This is used to

test the implementation - and will be used by the next CL that

implements AddObservationsForFilledForm().



Since observations are associated with stored types, this CL introduces

a mapping from supported types -> stored types. In particular, for every

derived type, the corresponding stored type is defined (see

GetStoredTypeOf()).
